sentences: Meie peaksime alati kuulama oma vanemaid.
context: The word 'kuulake' is the plural imperative form of the verb 'kuulama' in Estonian. It means 'listen!' or 'hear!' when addressed to multiple people. This form is used when giving a command or request to more than one person, similar to 'Listen!' or 'Please listen' in English but specifically for addressing a group.
